intro: Phyllanthus serandii, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a woody stem with a distinctive, milky sap. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of tropical flora and ecological systems.
